metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12692 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Keystone before 15.0.1, and 16.0.0.The EC2 API doesn't have a signature TTL check for AWS Signature V4. Anattacker can sniff the Authorization header, and then use it to reissue anOpenStack token an unlimited number of times.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12692` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

keystone - 2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1
keystone-common - 2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1
python3-keystone - 2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: keystone package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1').
